connector.description: Log messages to the underlying logging mechanism.

camel.sink.path.loggerName.name: camel.sink.path.loggerName
camel.sink.path.loggerName.description: Name of the logging category to use

camel.sink.endpoint.groupActiveOnly.name: camel.sink.endpoint.groupActiveOnly
camel.sink.endpoint.groupActiveOnly.description: If true, will hide stats when no new messages have been received for a time interval, if false, show stats regardless of message traffic.

camel.sink.endpoint.groupDelay.name: camel.sink.endpoint.groupDelay
camel.sink.endpoint.groupDelay.description: Set the initial delay for stats (in millis)

camel.sink.endpoint.groupInterval.name: camel.sink.endpoint.groupInterval
camel.sink.endpoint.groupInterval.description: If specified will group message stats by this time interval (in millis)

camel.sink.endpoint.groupSize.name: camel.sink.endpoint.groupSize
camel.sink.endpoint.groupSize.description: An integer that specifies a group size for throughput logging.

camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer.name: camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer
camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

camel.sink.endpoint.level.name: camel.sink.endpoint.level
camel.sink.endpoint.level.description: Logging level to use. The default value is INFO. One of: [ERROR] [WARN] [INFO] [DEBUG] [TRACE] [OFF]

camel.sink.endpoint.logMask.name: camel.sink.endpoint.logMask
camel.sink.endpoint.logMask.description: If true, mask sensitive information like password or passphrase in the log.

camel.sink.endpoint.marker.name: camel.sink.endpoint.marker
camel.sink.endpoint.marker.description: An optional Marker name to use.

camel.sink.endpoint.exchangeFormatter.name: camel.sink.endpoint.exchangeFormatter
camel.sink.endpoint.exchangeFormatter.description: To use a custom exchange formatter

camel.sink.endpoint.synchronous.name: camel.sink.endpoint.synchronous
camel.sink.endpoint.synchronous.description: Sets whether synchronous processing should be strictly used, or Camel is allowed to use asynchronous processing (if supported).

camel.sink.endpoint.maxChars.name: camel.sink.endpoint.maxChars
camel.sink.endpoint.maxChars.description: Limits the number of characters logged per line.

camel.sink.endpoint.multiline.name: camel.sink.endpoint.multiline
camel.sink.endpoint.multiline.description: If enabled then each information is outputted on a newline.

camel.sink.endpoint.showAll.name: camel.sink.endpoint.showAll
camel.sink.endpoint.showAll.description: Quick option for turning all options on. (multiline, maxChars has to be manually set if to be used)

camel.sink.endpoint.showCaughtException.name: camel.sink.endpoint.showCaughtException
camel.sink.endpoint.showCaughtException.description: If the exchange has a caught exception, show the exception message (no stack trace). A caught exception is stored as a property on the exchange (using the key org.apache.camel.Exchange#EXCEPTION_CAUGHT) and for instance a doCatch can catch exceptions.

camel.sink.endpoint.showException.name: camel.sink.endpoint.showException
camel.sink.endpoint.showException.description: If the exchange has an exception, show the exception message (no stacktrace)

camel.sink.endpoint.showExchangePattern.name: camel.sink.endpoint.showExchangePattern
camel.sink.endpoint.showExchangePattern.description: Shows the Message Exchange Pattern (or MEP for short).

camel.sink.endpoint.showFiles.name: camel.sink.endpoint.showFiles
camel.sink.endpoint.showFiles.description: If enabled Camel will output files

camel.sink.endpoint.showFuture.name: camel.sink.endpoint.showFuture
camel.sink.endpoint.showFuture.description: If enabled Camel will on Future objects wait for it to complete to obtain the payload to be logged.

camel.sink.endpoint.showStackTrace.name: camel.sink.endpoint.showStackTrace
camel.sink.endpoint.showStackTrace.description: Show the stack trace, if an exchange has an exception. Only effective if one of showAll, showException or showCaughtException are enabled.

camel.sink.endpoint.showStreams.name: camel.sink.endpoint.showStreams
camel.sink.endpoint.showStreams.description: Whether Camel should show stream bodies or not (eg such as java.io.InputStream). Beware if you enable this option then you may not be able later to access the message body as the stream have already been read by this logger. To remedy this you will have to use Stream Caching.

camel.sink.endpoint.skipBodyLineSeparato.name: camel.sink.endpoint.skipBodyLineSeparator
camel.sink.endpoint.skipBodyLineSeparato.description: Whether to skip line separators when logging the message body. This allows to log the message body in one line, setting this option to false will preserve any line separators from the body, which then will log the body as is.

camel.sink.endpoint.style.name: camel.sink.endpoint.style
camel.sink.endpoint.style.description: Sets the outputs style to use. One of: [Default] [Tab] [Fixed]

camel.component.log.lazyStartProducer.name: camel.component.log.lazyStartProducer
camel.component.log.lazyStartProducer.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

camel.component.log.autowiredEnabled.name: camel.component.log.autowiredEnabled
camel.component.log.autowiredEnabled.description: Whether autowiring is enabled. This is used for automatic autowiring options (the option must be marked as autowired) by looking up in the registry to find if there is a single instance of matching type, which then gets configured on the component. This can be used for automatic configuring JDBC data sources, JMS connection factories, AWS Clients, etc.

camel.component.log.exchangeFormatter.name: camel.component.log.exchangeFormatter
camel.component.log.exchangeFormatter.description: Sets a custom ExchangeFormatter to convert the Exchange to a String suitable for logging. If not specified, we default to DefaultExchangeFormatter.
